intro: Dodecatheon vulgare, commonly known as the common shooting star, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a whorl at the base of the plant. Dodecatheon vulgare is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in clusters along the edges of wetlands.
